sentences.english: Try to pay attention as you eat and stop when you're full.
sentences.chinese: 请尽量注意你的饱足感，如果你觉得饱了就不要再吃。

sentences.english: There is a saying in China, "a bite when hungry is better appreciated than a feast when full."
sentences.chinese: 中国有句话叫饥饿时喂一口，胜过饱足时给一顿。

sentences.english: Non-dieters pay more attention to their level of satiety , or fullness.
sentences.chinese: 非节食者则较留意他们的饱足感或满足感。

sentences.english: If you pick up a starving dog and make him prosperous, he will not bite you.
sentences.chinese: 如果你拣到一只饥饿的狗，使其饱足，它不会咬你。

sentences.english: Blessed are they which do hunger and thirst after righteousness: for they shall be filled.
sentences.chinese: 饥渴慕义的人有福了，因为他们必得饱足。

sentences.english: As a "peeping Tom", one ought to be satisfied this time.
sentences.chinese: 一个偷窥狂，这一次绝对有饱足欲。

sentences.english: His plan recommends revising what you eat, one meal at a time, to restore your sense of fullness
sentences.chinese: 他建议你调整三餐食谱，以恢复饱足感。

sentences.english: Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness, for they will be filled.
sentences.chinese: 饥渴募义的人有福了，因为他们必得饱足。

sentences.english: 'We found absolutely no difference in their satiety and hunger levels,' Dr. Sacks says.
sentences.chinese: 他说，我们发现他们的饱足和饥饿程度没有任何区别。

sentences.english: Lest I be full, and deny thee, and say, Who is the LORD?
sentences.chinese: 恐怕我饱足不认你，说，耶和华是谁呢。

definition: to eat and eat/to stuff oneself
to eat one's fill/to be full
to feed to the full/to cram
